segments.source_content: This week, I've been looking at the release of Lit 3.0 to see if the use of Web Components has become easier with React.

translations.fr: Cette semaine, j'ai examiné la sortie de Lit 3.0 pour voir si l'utilisation des Web Components est devenue plus simple avec React.
translations.en: Cette semaine, j'ai examiné la sortie de Lit 3.0 pour voir si l'utilisation des Web Components est devenue plus facile avec React.
translations.zh-hans: 本周，我一直在关注 Lit 3.0 的发布，看看在 React 中使用 Web Components 是否变得更容易了。

segments.source_content: On the React-Native side, version 0.73 is in release candidate with a number of DX improvements. There's also interesting activity regarding the possible optimisation of the Text and View components. Canvaskit-js makes it possible to run Skia on the web for just 20kb!

translations.fr: Côté React-Native, la version 0.73 est en release candidate avec plusieurs améliorations DX. On observe aussi une activité intéressante concernant l'optimisation potentielle des composants Text et View. Canvaskit-js permet d'exécuter Skia sur le web pour seulement 20ko !
translations.en: Côté React-Native, la version 0.73 est en candidate de publication avec plusieurs améliorations pour l'expérience développeur. On observe aussi des activités intéressantes concernant l'optimisation potentielle des composants Text et View. Canvaskit-js permet d'exécuter Skia sur le web pour seulement 20kb !
translations.zh-hans: 在 React-Native 方面，0.73 版本已进入发布候选阶段，带来了一系列开发者体验（DX）改进。同时，在优化 Text 和 View 组件方面也出现了一些有趣的活动。Canvaskit-js 使得在 Web 上仅用 20kb 就能运行 Skia 成为可能！

segments.source_content: There were some interesting announcements at ViteConf last week. Notably a Rust port of Rollup, and the usage of Vite with Remix and React-Native.

translations.fr: Il y a eu des annonces intéressantes lors de ViteConf la semaine dernière. Notamment un portage Rust de Rollup, et l'utilisation de Vite avec Remix et React-Native.
translations.en: Il y a eu des annonces intéressantes à la ViteConf la semaine dernière. Notamment un portage de Rollup en Rust, et l'utilisation de Vite avec Remix et React-Native.
translations.zh-hans: 上周的 ViteConf 上有一些有趣的公告，特别是 Rollup 的 Rust 移植版本，以及 Vite 在 Remix 和 React-Native 中的使用。

segments.source_content: Google's Web Components framework [Lit has just been released in v3.0](https://lit.dev/blog/2023-10-10-lit-3.0/). In addition to improvements to the framework (decorators, template compiler, Preact Signals), there is in particular the `@lit/react` integration package, which has graduated from the Lab, is now stable and in v1.0.

translations.fr: Le framework Web Components de Google [Lit vient d'être publié en v3.0](https://lit.dev/blog/2023-10-10-lit-3.0/). Outre des améliorations du framework (décorateurs, compilateur de templates, Preact Signals), on note particulièrement le package d'intégration `@lit/react`, désormais stable en v1.0.
translations.en: Le framework Web Components de Google [Lit vient d'être publié en v3.0](https://lit.dev/blog/2023-10-10-lit-3.0/). En plus d'améliorations du framework (décorateurs, compilateur de templates, Preact Signals), on trouve notamment le package d'intégration `@lit/react` qui a quitté le Lab, est désormais stable et en v1.0.
translations.zh-hans: Google 的 Web Components 框架 [Lit 刚发布了 v3.0](https://lit.dev/blog/2023-10-10-lit-3.0/)。除了框架本身的改进（装饰器、模板编译器、Preact Signals）外，特别值得一提的是 `@lit/react` 集成包已从实验室毕业，现在稳定处于 v1.0。

segments.source_content: This integration facilitates the use of Web Components in a React app (or Preact) by creating a wrapper that maps React props to the properties of the custom element, manages event handlers and facilitates TypeScript typing. It fills certain gaps in React 18, which does not integrate easily with Web Components: props are mapped to attributes rather than properties. See the [documentation for the React framework](https://lit.dev/docs/frameworks/react/).

translations.fr: Cette intégration facilite l'utilisation des Web Components dans une app React (ou Preact) en créant un wrapper qui mappe les props React vers les propriétés du custom element, gère les gestionnaires d'événements et facilite le typage TypeScript. Elle comble certaines lacunes de React 18 qui n'intègre pas facilement les Web Components : les props sont mappés en attributs plutôt qu'en propriétés. Voir la [documentation pour le framework React](https://lit.dev/docs/frameworks/react/).
translations.en: Cette intégration facilite l'utilisation des Web Components dans une app React (ou Preact) en créant un wrapper qui mappe les props React aux propriétés du custom element, gère les gestionnaires d'événements et facilite le typage TypeScript. Elle comble certaines lacunes de React 18 qui n'intègre pas facilement les Web Components : les props sont mappées vers des attributs plutôt que des propriétés. Voir la [documentation pour le framework React](https://lit.dev/docs/frameworks/react/).
translations.zh-hans: 该集成通过创建包装器将 React props 映射到自定义元素的属性，管理事件处理程序并简化 TypeScript 类型，从而简化了在 React 应用（或 Preact）中使用 Web Components 的过程。它弥补了 React 18 与 Web Components 集成不便的缺陷：props 原本只能映射为 attributes 而非 properties。详见 [React 框架文档](https://lit.dev/docs/frameworks/react/)。

segments.source_content: But can a modern React dev use all this easily? Lit offers experimental packages [@lit-labs/ssr](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/ssr), [@lit-labs/ssr-react](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/ssr-react) and [@lit-labs/nextjs](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/nextjs) but support is limited and won't work with Next.js App Router. The [Declarative Shadow DOM](https://developer.chrome.com/articles/declarative-shadow-dom/), which allows SSR, is not yet implemented in Firefox, but a polyfill exists. In short, Lit should work well on a CRA app, but still feels a bit risky if you need SSR and SEO.

translations.fr: Mais un développeur React moderne peut-il utiliser tout cela facilement ? Lit propose des packages expérimentaux [@lit-labs/ssr](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/ssr), [@lit-labs/ssr-react](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/ssr-react) et [@lit-labs/nextjs](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/nextjs) mais le support est limité et ne fonctionne pas avec Next.js App Router. Le [Declarative Shadow DOM](https://developer.chrome.com/articles/declarative-shadow-dom/) permettant le SSR n'est pas encore implémenté dans Firefox, mais un polyfill existe. En bref, Lit devrait bien fonctionner sur une app CRA, mais reste un peu risqué si vous avez besoin de SSR et SEO.
translations.en: Mais un développeur React moderne peut-il utiliser tout cela facilement ? Lit propose des packages expérimentaux [@lit-labs/ssr](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/ssr), [@lit-labs/ssr-react](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/ssr-react) et [@lit-labs/nextjs](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/nextjs) mais le support est limité et ne fonctionnera pas avec Next.js App Router. Le [Shadow DOM déclaratif](https://developer.chrome.com/articles/declarative-shadow-dom/), qui permet le SSR, n'est pas encore implémenté dans Firefox, mais un polyfill existe. Bref, Lit devrait bien fonctionner sur une app CRA, mais semble encore un peu risqué si vous avez besoin de SSR et SEO.
translations.zh-hans: 但现代 React 开发者能轻松使用这些吗？Lit 提供了实验性包 [@lit-labs/ssr](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/ssr)、[@lit-labs/ssr-react](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/ssr-react) 和 [@lit-labs/nextjs](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@lit-labs/nextjs)，但支持有限且不兼容 Next.js App Router。支持 SSR 的[声明式 Shadow DOM](https://developer.chrome.com/articles/declarative-shadow-dom/) 尚未在 Firefox 实现，但有 polyfill 可用。简言之，Lit 在 CRA 应用中表现良好，但如需 SSR 和 SEO 则仍有风险。

segments.source_content:
- 💸 [Create collaborative applications like Figma and Miro in a few lines of code with Ably's in-app collaboration SDK](https://hubs.la/Q023nqgg0)
- 👀 [Remix PR - Add experimental Vite support](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/pull/7590)
- 👀 [Remix PR - Add startViewTransition support](https://github.com/remix-run/react-router/pull/10916)
- 👀 [Next.js PR - Document Server Actions `.bind` method](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/56164): the [Next.js doc](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/api-reference/functions/server-actions#binding-arguments) now recommends using `myAction.bind(null, myArg)` to pass additional arguments to a Server Action. The returned function will then also be a Server Action.
- 📜 [UI Composition - AKA taking a step back to take a step forward](https://kyleshevlin.com/ui-composition): article presenting an example of a Card component that has too much responsibility. Suggests splitting it and using composition to make it more maintainable.
- 📜 [Server-side pagination with Remix](https://www.jacobparis.com/content/remix-pagination): I found this implementation very interesting, with no `onClick` listener or JS to manipulate the query string. It relies solely on the native behaviour of forms and is therefore compatible with progressive enhancement. My reservation: impossible to open a page in a new tab 😅.
- 📜 [Access the Loader Data in Remix](https://sergiodxa.com/tutorials/access-loaders-data-in-remix): presents different ways of using `useLoaderData` or `useRouteLoaderData` and their tradeoffs, depending on where they are used.
- 📜 [Why I love Remix, And why you should too](https://alemtuzlak.hashnode.dev/why-i-love-remix)
- 📜 [Making React Apps Memory Efficient - Million.js Beyond Speed](https://dev.to/ricardonunezio/millionjs-beyond-speed-making-react-apps-memory-efficient-2amn)
- 📜 [Test your React Libraries Locally with Yalc](https://www.propelauth.com/post/test-your-react-libraries-with-yalc)
- 📜 [Why we still use React HOCs](https://www.propelauth.com/post/why-we-have-both-react-hooks-and-hocs)
- 📜 [Progressively Enhanced WebGL Lens Refraction](https://tympanus.net/codrops/2023/10/10/progressively-enhanced-webgl-lens-refraction/)
- 📦 [Fresh v1.5 - Partials, client side navigation and more](https://deno.com/blog/fresh-1.5): the Preact framework implements client-side navigation based on "Partials", which permits to preserve some state during navigation. View Transitions support is on the way.
- 📦 [next-safe-action v4 - Typesafe Server Actions in your Next.js 13 app](https://next-safe-action.dev/): input validation with Zod. Note: a similar project [Zact](https://github.com/pingdotgg/zact) is deprecated in favour of `next-safe-action`.
- 📦 [Astro Starlight v0.11](https://github.com/withastro/starlight/releases/tag/%40astrojs%2Fstarlight%400.11.0): adds support for [component overrides](https://starlight.astro.build/guides/overriding-components/) to customize docs.
- 📦 [React-Query 5.0.0 RC.10](https://github.com/TanStack/query/releases/tag/v5.0.0-rc.10): the latest RCs bring significant improvements to [🐦 devtools](https://twitter.com/TkDodo/status/1711297673934848388) and [🐦 TypeScript](https://twitter.com/TkDodo/status/1711635656642855297).
- 🔗 [ServerComponents.dev](https://servercomponents.dev/): a fun interactive resource to find out more about Server Components.
- 🎥 [What's new in Remotion – September 2023](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ol-571DOPDY)
- 📅 [React Jam - October 19-29th - React devs create and play games in 10 days](https://reactjam.com/)

translations.en: [**Utilisation de RCTView et RCTText dans React Native pour des gains de performance**](https://blog.theodo.com/2023/10/native-views-rn-performance/)
translations.zh-hans: [**在 React Native 中使用 RCTView 和 RCTText 实现性能提升**](https://blog.theodo.com/2023/10/native-views-rn-performance/)

segments.source_content: At the moment, React-Native devs are talking a lot [on Twitter](https://twitter.com/FernandoTheRojo/status/1707762822015267219) about the perf of the `Text` and `View` components, which are JS wrappers and add overhead compared to the respective native `RCTText` and `RCTView` elements. William Candillon had already 🎥 [explained this problem](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1D78Tc46Xqo&t=1156s) in 2021, with the possibility of optimising Text rendering. It is possible to optimize as long as you don't need a few features like `onPress` listeners. This article presents a benchmark and measures the impact of using the native components instead of regular components, and reports a gain of around 15%, with variations depending on the platform and architecture.

translations.fr: Actuellement, les développeurs React-Native discutent beaucoup [sur Twitter](https://twitter.com/FernandoTheRojo/status/1707762822015267219) des performances des composants `Text` et `View`, qui sont des wrappers JS ajoutant une surcharge comparé aux éléments natifs `RCTText` et `RCTView`. William Candillon avait déjà 🎥 [expliqué ce problème](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1D78Tc46Xqo&t=1156s) en 2021, évoquant la possibilité d'optimiser le rendu du texte. Cette optimisation est possible tant qu'on n'a pas besoin de fonctionnalités comme les écouteurs `onPress`. Cet article présente un benchmark mesurant l'impact de l'utilisation des composants natifs, rapportant un gain d'environ 15%, avec des variations selon la plateforme et l'architecture.
translations.en: Actuellement, les développeurs React-Native discutent beaucoup [sur Twitter](https://twitter.com/FernandoTheRojo/status/1707762822015267219) des performances des composants `Text` et `View`, qui sont des wrappers JS ajoutant une surcharge par rapport aux éléments natifs `RCTText` et `RCTView`. William Candillon avait déjà 🎥 [expliqué ce problème](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1D78Tc46Xqo&t=1156s) en 2021, évoquant l'optimisation possible du rendu texte. Cette optimisation est réalisable tant que certaines fonctionnalités comme les écouteurs `onPress` ne sont pas nécessaires. L'article présente un benchmark mesurant l'impact des composants natifs versus réguliers, rapportant un gain d'environ 15%, avec des variations selon la plateforme et l'architecture.
translations.zh-hans: 目前，React Native 开发者正在[Twitter](https://twitter.com/FernandoTheRojo/status/1707762822015267219)上热议 `Text` 和 `View` 组件的性能问题。这些 JavaScript 包装器相比原生 `RCTText` 和 `RCTView` 元素会增加开销。William Candillon 早在 2021 年就通过🎥[视频解释过此问题](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1D78Tc46Xqo&t=1156s)，并提出了优化文本渲染的可能性。只要不需要 `onPress` 监听器等少数功能，即可实现优化。本文通过基准测试衡量了使用原生组件替代常规组件的影响，结果显示性能提升约 15%，具体效果因平台和架构而异。

segments.source_content: Now that this trick became mainstream, React-Native devs are keen to take advantage of it. We can note the creation of [react-native-fast-text](https://github.com/peterpme/react-native-fast-text), or the POC of a Babel plugin [react-native-optimizer](https://github.com/marklawlor/react-native-optimizer) which would apply this optimisation automatically.

translations.fr: Maintenant que cette technique se généralise, les développeurs cherchent à en profiter. On note la création de [react-native-fast-text](https://github.com/peterpme/react-native-fast-text) ou le POC d'un plugin Babel [react-native-optimizer](https://github.com/marklawlor/react-native-optimizer) qui appliquerait automatiquement cette optimisation.
translations.en: Cette technique devenant mainstream, les développeurs React-Native cherchent à en profiter. On note la création de [react-native-fast-text](https://github.com/peterpme/react-native-fast-text) ou le POC d'un plugin Babel [react-native-optimizer](https://github.com/marklawlor/react-native-optimizer) appliquant automatiquement cette optimisation.
translations.zh-hans: 随着该技巧的普及，React Native 开发者正积极利用这一优化。值得注意的是[react-native-fast-text](https://github.com/peterpme/react-native-fast-text)的创建，以及可自动应用此优化的 Babel 插件 POC [react-native-optimizer](https://github.com/marklawlor/react-native-optimizer)。

segments.source_content:
- 💸 [Blitz - Build React Native Apps Faster for iOS, Android, and Web!](https://www.blitz-rn.com/)
- 🐦 [Expo docs updates - Bun, local dev, iOS capabilities...](https://twitter.com/amanhimself/status/1710254359274037263)
- 📜 [How to measure React Native performance with Flashlight](https://www.bam.tech/article/measuring-react-native-performance-with-flashlight): shows an example of using Flashlight to compare the scrolling performance of FlatList and Flashlist on Android. You can use ADB or Maestro commands to simulate scrolling.
- 📜 [Remote controls for React TV apps: a declarative approach with react-tv-space-navigation 1.0!](https://www.bam.tech/article/handling-remote-controls-in-tv-apps-the-react-way-with-react-tv-space-navigation-1-0): details leading to the creation of [react-tv-space-navigation](https://github.com/bamlab/react-tv-space-navigation), a cross-platform, agnostic spatial navigation solution that works on React TV apps, both web-based and native.
- 📦 [React-Native v0.73 RC.2](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.73.0-rc.2): v0.73 has just been released in RC. You'll have to check out the [🎥 Keynote at React-Native-EU](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-rCRgbsJumk) to see all the highlights. These include one-click debug flow and stable symlinks support!
- 📦 [vxrn - The magic of Vite, meet React Native](https://vxrn.dev/): new experimental project wants to use Vite for cross-platform React-Native development, contrary to Expo, betting on Metro.
- 📦 [Vision-Camera 3.3 - QR-code/Barcode scanner](https://github.com/mrousavy/react-native-vision-camera/releases/tag/v3.3.0)
- 📦 [Vision-Camera-Barcode-Scanner](https://github.com/mgcrea/vision-camera-barcode-scanner)
- 📦 [Create-Expo-Stack CLI v2](https://expostack.dev/)
- 🎥 [Back to the Web](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3p3NI1yIgcM): William Candillon unveils an experimental polyfill for Skia `canvaskit-js` that lets you run React-Native-Skia on the web in just 20kb, instead of 3mb! Flutter demos already run pretty well with it. You can use it in a Create-React-App without depending on React-Native-Web.
- 🎥 [What’s the Best React Native Storage Option?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wVNPmxntwKQ)
- 🎙️ [React-Native-Radio 277 - Expo Launch Party](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-277-expo-launch-party)
- 🎙 [The React Native Show Podcast 28 - Improving Developer Experience with Expo](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4PPDAvgfLHk)
